text: Justin Ernest George Morneau (born May 15, 1981 in New Westminster, British Columbia) is a Canadian baseball player. He currently plays as a first baseman for the Minnesota Twins of Major League Baseball. He made his MLB debut for the Minnesota Twins on June 10, 2003. He won the American League MVP Award in 2006. He also won the 2008 Home Run Derby and two Silver Slugger Awards in 2008. He wears the number 33 to honour his idol, former NHL goaltender Patrick Roy. He would also not leave the car for hockey games when he was younger until the clock read :33 minutes past the hour. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website *Justin Morneau's MLB player profile Category:Canadian baseball players Category:Minnesota Twins players Category:Sportspeople from British Columbia Category:1981 births Category:Living people
title: Justin Morneau
